ygData.subject: Re: Stats for a char
ygData.msgSnippet: increased AGI translates into AC, which means less hits and damage taken, which means less need for healing, which means less chance for clerics getting
ygData.messageBody:
"increased AGI translates into AC, which means
less hits and damage taken, which means less need for
healing, which means less chance for clerics getting
agro"<br><br>Admittedly, yes you would get hit less. And healing would be
less needed. But actually that causes Agro factor to
increase on clerics.<br><br>If you're completely
invulnerable, you lose agro completely. Mobs only like to hit
you if you do a lot of damage to them AND they can do
damage to you. Taunt helps a lot. If you're a Ranger or
especially SK... you can really gain agro and keep it. Cause
nothing says hating like a good flame like/debuff or a
good blinding/snare from an SK. (In which case you
could justify the Agility)<br><br>The pure warrior
should avoid agility b/c they've got enough armor stuff
to increase AC as it is and damage/way to make and
hold agro. (Root is a good way to control agro and
adds if you don't have mezzers/charmers. Snare however
is better for overall mana)<br><br>Rangers, Monks,
Rogues, SK and almost all casters are going to make it
hard to hold agro and keep you a "true" tank. Even
Paly's can hold agro better with their stun
series.<br><br>shooman out<br><br>PS.. all that typing to say.. "I said
agility is not a factor b/c warriors were the point in
question."
